results.definition: characteristic of or meant for a single person or thing
being or characteristic of a single thing or person
not divided among or brought to bear on more than one object or objective
examples: judging a contest with a single eye

results.definition: not married or related to the unmarried state
a base hit on which the batter stops safely at first base
the smallest whole number or a numeral representing this number
existing alone or consisting of one entity or part or aspect or individual
examples: upon the hill stood a single tower
had but a single thought which was to escape
a single legal code for all
the batter singled to left field

results.definition: used of flowers having usually only one row or whorl of petals
examples: single chrysanthemums resemble daisies and may have more than one row of petals
